trustfund:
TF030796-JAPAN CTF - FY06 GENERAL: EAP
            (ALL COUNTRIES IN EAST ASIA AND PACIFIC/A,TF055712-PF III PI-EASHD,TF091233-SB HEALTH SECTOR SUPPORT
            PROJECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Solomon Islands' Health Sector
            Support Program Technical Assistance Project's
            development objective is to improve the institutional
            capacity of the Ministry of Health and Medical Services
            (MHMS) in the areas of public expenditure management and
            sector performance monitoring. Such capacity development
            will be critical to the overall success of the Health Sector
            Support Program (HSSP) in improving health services delivery
            and outcomes. The project's first component is: Public
            Expenditure Management. This project component will
            contribute technical assistance to complete the first
            rolling sector Medium Term Expenditure Framework (MTEF), and
            improve national MHMS and provincial health planning and
            budgeting systems and procedures, building on work done
            during preparation, so that priorities are set within a
            known resource envelope and linked to expected results. The
            second component is: Sector performance monitoring. This
            project component will provide technical assistance to
            improve the sector-wide program's Monitoring and
            Evaluation (M&E) framework to focus on a core set of
            indicators covering the key dimensions of sector performance
            along key dimensions. The third component is: training and
            capacity building. This component will strengthen the
            management capacity of senior managers and provincial health
            directors to be more effective in strategic planning and
            execution. It will also finance part of the MHMS strategic
            human resource training plan.
